questionTitle: _________ computing refers to applications and services that run on a distributed network using virtualized resources.
questionExplanation: Cloud Computing applications are accessed by common Internet protocols and networking standards.

questionOption1: The massive scale of cloud computing systems was enabled by the popularization of the Internet
questionOption2: Soft computing represents a real paradigm shift in the way in which systems are deployed
questionOption3: Cloud computing makes the long-held dream of utility computing possible with a pay-as-you-go, infinitely scalable, universally available system
questionExplanation: Cloud Computing is distinguished by the notion that resources are virtual and limitless and that details of the physical systems on which software runs are abstracted from the user.

questionTitle: ________ as a utility is a dream that dates from the beginning of the computing industry itself.
questionExplanation: Cloud computing takes the technology, services, and applications that are similar to those on the Internet and turns them into a self-service utility.

questionTitle: Which of the following is essential concept related to Cloud?
questionExplanation: Cloud computing abstracts the details of system implementation from users and developers.

questionOption1: All applications benefit from deployment in the cloud
questionOption2: With cloud computing, you can start very small and become big very fast
questionOption3: Cloud computing is revolutionary, even if the technology it is built on is evolutionary
questionExplanation: Issues with latency, transaction control, and in particular security and regulatory compliance are of particular concern.

questionTitle: Which of the following cloud concept is related to pooling and sharing of resources?
questionExplanation: Applications run on physical systems that aren’t specified, data is stored in locations that are unknown, administration of systems is outsourced to others, and access by users is ubiquitous.

questionTitle: ________ has many of the characteristics of what is now being called cloud computing.
questionExplanation: The Internet offers abstraction, runs using the same set of protocols and standards, and uses the same applications and operating systems.

questionTitle: Which of the following can be identified as cloud?
questionExplanation: When an intranet becomes large enough that a diagram no longer wishes to differentiate between individual physical systems, the intranet too becomes identified as a cloud.

questionTitle: Cloud computing is an abstraction based on the notion of pooling physical resources and presenting them as a ________ resource.
questionExplanation: Cloud Computing is a new model for provisioning resources, for staging applications, and for platform-independent user access to services.

questionTitle: Which of the following is Cloud Platform by Amazon?
questionExplanation: One of the most successful cloud-based businesses is Amazon Web Services, which is an Infrastructure as a Service offering that lets you rent virtual computers on Amazon’s own infrastructure.
